notes: Krug has been diagnosed with pre-arthritic changes in his left ankle and will be re-evaluated in 6-8 weeks.
Couture (groin) is feeling better and hopes to resume skating in July, Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey Now reports.
Lehkonen is expected to undergo a shoulder procedure according to general manager Chris MacFarland, Brennan Vogt of The-Rink.com reports.
Boeser is OUT indefinitely and will not play in Monday's (May 20) game versus Edmonton.
Nichushkin was placed in Stage 3 of the NHL/NHLPA player assistance program and suspended for a minimum of six months without pay for violating the terms of Stage 2, the NHL and NHLPA announced.
Fast will miss the remainder of the playoffs with an upper body injury. Still has no update or status for return
McMann is making strides in his recovery but is not close to returning to action, Lance Hornby of The Toronto Sun reports.
Dunn is expected to miss the remainder of the 2023-24 season.
Xhekaj will undergo season-ending surgery on his left shoulder on Tuesday (Apr. 9).
Bean suffered a broken hand in Thursday's (Apr. 4) game against the Islanders and will miss the rest of the season.
The Pittsburgh Penguins placed D Ryan Graves on the Injured Reserve.
Foligno will undergo season-ending surgery according to Michael Russo of The Athletic.
The Blues announced that Sundqvist will undergo surgery on his right knee and be re-evaluated in six months.
The Pittsburgh Penguins placed Acciari on Injured Reserve.
The Colorado Avalanche placed O'Connor on injured reserve Monday (Mar. 25), per CapFriendly.
The Columbus Blue Jackets placed F Kent Johnson on injured reserve.
The San Jose Sharks announced D Ty Emberson is not expected to play again this season after head coach David Quinn told reporters Monday (Mar. 25), per Max Miller of The Hockey News.
The New York Islanders announced D Scott Mayfield had successful season-ending surgery.
The New Jersey Devils placed F Nathan Bastian on Injured Reserve.
Sharks GM Mike Grier said he expects Vanecek to be healthy to start the 2024-2025 season.
The Boston Bruins placed F Matthew Poitras on long-term injured reserve.
The Buffalo Sabres placed D Mattias Samuelsson on Injured Reserve.
The Kings announced that Copley underwent surgery for a torn ACL and is out for the season.
Laine entered the NHL/NHLPA Player Assistance Program and will be out indefinitely.
The Sharks announced that Benning's estimated time of recovery is approximately five months.

Nieto (knee) sustained an undisclosed injury while rehabbing from his knee surgery. The center could find himself heading back under the knife ahead of the 2024-25 campaign, Seth Rorabaugh of Tribune-Review Sports reports.
The Blackhawks announced that Hall underwent successful surgery on his right ACL in (Oct. 2023), but no definite date on a return.
The Washington Capitals placed F Nicklas Backstrom on Injured Reserve.
The Philadelphia Flyers placed D Ryan Ellis on Injured Reserve.
The Minnesota Wild placed F Sam Hentges on Injured Reserve.
The Vancouver Canucks placed D Tucker Poolman on Injured Reserve.
The Avalanche announced Landeskog is expected to miss the entire 2023-24 season. There is no return date or update on status for the 2024-2025 season.
